thread.title: UK inflation expectations edged higher in September
thread.title_full: UK inflation expectations edged higher in September

title: UK inflation expectations edged higher in September
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Oct 8, 2015, 14:46 BST - UK Markets close in 1 hr 44 mins UK inflation expectations edged higher in September By Alexander Bueso | Sharecast – 11 minutes ago 4,625.00 +85.00 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Inflation expectations among Britons for the next twelve months increased slightly in September. Twelve months out, the cost of living was seen rising at a 1.5% clip according to the results of the latest monthly YouGov (LSE: YOU.L - news ) /Citi survey. 
That was one tenth of a percentage point higher than in the previous month. 
Expectations for inflation over the next five to ten years were stable at 2.7%. 
"The low level of inflation expectations probably will not prevent pay growth picking up a bit in the coming year, but probably does signal that any pickup in pay will be modest rather than sharp," Citi economist Michael Saunders said. 
"Against this background - and with signs that growth is slowing - there is no urgent need for the MPC (KOSDAQ: 050540.KQ - news ) to hike rates at present."
